items.title: Fashion Copywriter
items.content:
Fashion Copywriter at ONYCHEK

New York City, Remote · Internship
Skills
Content Management, Ecommerce, Online Marketing and Copywriting, Content Marketing, Copy Writing and Editing, Fashion Journalism, Experience Luxury Beauty/Fashion Industry, Product Description
Compensation
$8K–$10K
No Equity
Visa Sponsorship
Not available

Job Description

Are you interested in working for a fashion startup? Are you interested in an opportunity for you to make a great impact from Day 1 of the company launching? We are looking for a paid fashion copywriter intern, who is interested in the infusion of African luxury fashion and amazing content.

Our team is very keen in identifying topics and stories that appeal to our audience. We create and distribute content that helps establish ONYCHEK Blog, THEINSIGHT, as a trusted source of African luxury fashion information, inspiration, and commerce. A successful candidate would enjoy writing marketing content for fashion topics such as culture, styling tips, fabrics, "how to" and history.

This internship position will work directly with the CEO and content creator lead in coordinating content production.

About ONYCHEK

ONYCHEK.com is a New York based African Luxury Fashion ecommerce startup. We are making African Luxury Fashion easily accessible to the world.

Responsibilities

Write content for the ONYCHEK blog, product descriptions, and our social media handles
Research, write, and/or edit many other types of content, which could include: emails, articles, social media posts, editorials, presentations, emails, and web copy
Work with team members to brainstorm, develop, create, and promote content that appeals to our global audience
Help manage and maintain all the behind-the-scenes systems and processes that keep us running well: editorial calendars, content inventories, analytics, etc.

Requirements
Ability to turn ideas into compelling concepts/copy
Ability to flexibly adapt your writing style to our audience
Strong editing and proofreading skills
Experience working in customer service is a plus
Experience with Photoshop, Google Analytics, HTML, video editing, social media marketing is a major plus

Characteristics
Passion for the written word, creativity, and content marketing
Demonstrated aptitude for storytelling
Entrepreneurial, team player
Excitement for all aspects of content development - idea generation, research, writing, gathering input and buy in, editing, collaborating with web designer/developer. For watching your work make impact
A healthy respect for deadlines, and the drive to see projects through to completion
Motivated to learn new skills and disciplines
Self motivated/ self starter
Willing to try new things
HTML and CSS experience will be helpful

What You Will Learn:
The ability to move fast in decision making
Growing a fashion startup
Wearing different hats at the same time
Quick reiteration

Details:
Candidate should be willing to work between 10-20 hours a week and can be remote.

Please send resume to team@onychek.com

items.title: Wildbit: Content Strategist/Copywriter
items.content:
Full-time

(Anywhere or Philadelphia, PA)

We’re looking for a content strategist to really help us improve and formalize our approach to content strategy and help make it a more consistent part of our process. We’re not pefrect, and we could really use help with our content strategy, editorial, and copyrighting. We have a deep appreciation for content, and we’re ready to do more than just wing it. Can you help?

Be the champion for content on a growing team

Do you get excited thinking about establishing tone and voice guidelines for products and teams? Does writing and editing blog posts and guides to help customers sound like fun? Do you enjoy writing marketing copy and crafting the story for landing pages? Are you interested in helping define the editorial process for a growing team? Do you love writing and editing technical content aimed at developers?

Focus on helping customers succeed

At Wildbit, content is all about helping our customers succeed. Our marketing and customer success team work hand-in-hand to make that happen. In some cases, that means educating customers about new industry technology or standards, and in others, it’s simply about teaching them the ins and outs of our products. We’re always looking for ways to improve how we share information with customers. 

Be incredibly comfortable with technology and communicating with developers

Since virtually all of our customers are developers, it’s critical that all of our content focuses on the needs and interests of developers. Generally speaking, that means we’re laser-focused on substance over filler or fluff.  We’re mindful of quantitative things like metrics and SEO, but we don’t believe that should drive our content strategy. It can play a role informing the strategy, but it’s not our guiding light.

Do a little bit of everything as we grow

A typical day could involve writing or editing content for the blog or our newsletter. Or you might review analytics or SEO tools to see what we’re doing right (or wrong). Maybe you’ll be producing a new blog post in our CMS (Craft) or planning our upcoming month’s editorial and social media content promotion. Or maybe you’re heads down crafting that just-right marketing copy for an upcoming feature announcement. You could even help us improve our journey towards more video content.

Be a part of a team with a healthy and supportive approach to work

If you love words and have a passion for using technology to communicate, we’d love to talk. Wildbit is remote-friendly and family-friendly with quarterly profit sharing and yearly team retreats to great locations. If you’re in Philly, we even have chef-prepared family-style lunches at the office every day. It may sound corny and difficult to believe, but we really do operate like a family and do our best to support each other and help each other grow in a healthy team environment.

Wildbit is an equal opportunity employer and proud of it.

We’re committed to building a diverse team, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. At our core we believe deeply in diversity, inclusiveness, and acceptance as all being key parts of a healthy team.

Job Perks: Chef-prepared family lunches in Philly office, Full health benefits, Company-paid retreats, Computer setup of your choice, 25 paid days off per year, Quarterly Profit sharing, Attend conferences, Quiet Fridays, 40 hour work week

items.title: Copywriter
items.content:
*COMPANY INTRO*
This is a unique opportunity to join a founding team and impact every renter in the UK through exciting and highly rewarding work

With Generation Rent just around the corner we expect more people renting than ever before. That’s why we believes renting should be more affordable, accessible and rely less on the Mum-and-Dad’s bank. We are a young and innovative startup company solving an affordability problem by offering deposit-free renting to millions of Tenants across the UK - with lots more exciting stuff to come.

We have built a core team and a product we are proud of, partnered with industry leaders, raised significant start capital and are now moments away from launching with the UK largest independent letting agent.

*ROLE DESCRIPTION*
A unique opportunity to join a young start-up company and shape the future of its marketing communication, tone of voice and the language style used across all mediums. This is a part-time job with the potential to becoming a full-time.

*RESPONSIBILITIES*
* Create the company communication style and tone of voice
* Standardise ways of addressing business questions and marketing related explanations
* Proof read all company material and ensure correct use of english and adherence to TOV
* Manage all social footprint of the company (Linkedin, Twitter, Facebook, G+, Instagram, Blog...etc)
* Produce text for applications across competitions and other events
* Create newsletters and other marketing communications
* Create app copy and platform emails
* Create text for internal decks and presentations
* Create copy for drip email campaigns

*QUALITIES*
* Graduate degree from an english speaking university
* Experience in writing corporate copy and communication material Must be native English speaker (or excellent English speaker)
* Enthusiasm and self drive to do what’s needed with limited guidance
* Exceptional communication skills
* Exceptional organisational skills and attention to detail

*BENEFITS*
We offer the following benefits to all flatfair employees (not to mention, awesome work environment, inspiring colleagues and a ton of fun).
* Stock options
* Competitive salary reviewed every 6 months
* Flexible working hours
* 25 paid holiday days
* Free lunch + Snacks!
* Private health insurance
* Workplace pension scheme
* Weekly socials events
* Choose your own equipment

We are looking for a talented video editor to assemble recorded footage into a finished project that matches director’s vision and is suitable for broadcasting.

Ultimately, as a film and video editor, you should be able to bring sight and sound together in order to tell a cohesive story

Manipulate and edit film pieces in a way that is invisible to the audience

Input music, dialogues, graphics and effects
Create rough and final cuts
Ensure logical sequencing and smooth running
Consult with stakeholders from production to post-production process
Continuously discover and implement new editing technologies and industry’s best practices to maximize efficiency.

items.title: SiteGround: English Content Writer - Remote
items.content:
English Content Writer - Remote

Posted Dec 6

SiteGround
Headquarters: Sofia, Bulgaria
https://www.siteground.com/careers

About You

You love the written word, it’s an artform to you that allows you to explain how technical products solve people's problems. You’re the person who corrects others’ grammar and spelling, because grammar and spelling are really important (people who don’t think that need their head read). You’re sensitive about the Oxford comma?
 
You’ve also got some experience with websites, which could be as simple as setting up your own WordPress blog or as advanced as doing some PHP development in your own time.

You want to work remotely and you’re looking for the perfect job that doesn’t restrict you to one place.

If you’ve been nodding your head to all of the above, read on.

About Us

We’re a team of technical, service and marketing experts who believe in helping customers leverage technology to get better results for their business. Our main service is web hosting, and we’re really good at it. So good, in fact, we’re one of the only 3 web hosts worldwide recommended by WordPress.org.

SiteGround was founded in Bulgaria in 2004 and sell to clients all over the world. Today we have 5 offices between Bulgaria and Spain, five data centers on 3 continents and host over 800 0000 domains. Due to our continuous growth we are are looking for writers and content experts to build our content team.

The Role

Working for the brand manager, you’ll be helping craft content for different market segments, speaking their language and clearly communicating what they need to know to help them run their online business or hobby better.

You’ll be writing articles, producing ebooks, and refining social media posts on a daily basis.

Requirements

The most important thing is you share our values of Craftsmanship, Quality, Passion, and a sense of Fun. You’ll have to demonstrate each of these in your application.

You have 2+ years of experience writing content, and have the examples to prove it along with stats to show reach and engagement with the target audience.

Benefits

  • Work anywhere in the world, as long as you have 4 hours overlap with Eastern Europe office hours (GMT+3);
  • Permanent contract;
  • Young and friendly team of professionals;
  • Informal and fun working culture;
  • Macbook workstation;
  • Annual Remote Team Building.

If you are interested, please send to jobs@siteground.com your CV and a piece of content explaining why you are the ideal person. We get lots of applications for these types of roles, so make sure you stand out.

Please note: Due to the volume of applications only shortlisted candidates will be contacted for further steps.

Apply for this position

Send to jobs@siteground.com your CV and a piece of content explaining why you are the ideal person.

items.title: Copywriter/Creative Strategist
items.content:
Status

Status is building powerful decentralized apps on Ethereum that change the way we do things on the web. Our rapidly growing team is made up of self-motivated individuals who prosper in a fast-paced environment and value the ability to work from anywhere.

As a product, Status is an open source discovery tool for the Ethereum blockchain that makes it easy for anyone to access apps and services built on the decentralized web. Status also allows users to browse, chat, make payments and more.

Opportunity

Although still in its infancy, blockchain technology is developing rapidly and is poised to have a profound impact on our social, financial and legal systems. By joining us, you’ll help to craft the way people interact with these technologies.

Job role

We are looking for a Copywriter/Creative Strategist to be part of our Marketing team and serve as principal writer and editor of all marketing and advertising copy.

You’re a self-starter and team player with a natural love of the written word, looking to add value to our brand story and product development. You will help define the marketing strategies that ladder up to the larger business and product goals.

Responsibilities

  • Write clear, concise, and conversational copy,
  • Ensure tone and style, across all mediums
  • Lead the creative strategy for marketing campaigns and promotional materials
  • Collaborate closely with the product and brand/marketing teams to come up with creative solutions.
  • Work with stakeholders and reviewers to keep the brand voice consistent
  • Develop communication strategies and all creative aspects of campaign development
  • Write functional UI copy
  • Develop clear content strategy which spans across all communication and product

Requirements

  • A minimum of 4 years writing copy for brands in an in-house creative department and/or agency role
  • Experience in Journalism and editorial writing is a plus
  • You know what makes a killer headline and have a knack for both writing and editing
  • Ability to move quickly, test the copy you create, and iterate to find the perfect performance-based solution
  • Excellent English writing and editing skills
  • You take initiative, keep organized, and can handle multiple projects at once
  • Strong problem-solving skills, ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment, and close attention to detail

Working at Status

Status is a decentralized organization. You will not have a boss or a work schedule. What you will have is responsibility to your collaborators to do your best, keep up with your responsibilities, and support your team's priorities. At Status we are all working toward the goal of expanding and supporting the Ethereum space

items.title: Nugg: Editor-in-Chief at High-Growth Cannabis Tech Startup
items.content:
Editor-in-Chief at High-Growth Cannabis Tech Startup

Posted Nov 20

Nugg
Headquarters: Los Angeles
www.getnugg.com

Nugg is one of the hottest startups in the $30-50 billion cannabis space. If you are passionate about joining a dynamic company that is already a leader in it’s industry (and has massive growth potential), Nugg is the right place for you.

We are seeking a full-time Editor-in-Chief to 1) ensure all our content efforts are on-brand and resonate with our target audiences, and 2) obsess over improving KPI's and conversions for blog content.

WHAT YOU’LL BE CHARGED WITH:

We are looking for a rockstar writer, editor and curator who knows how to use technical platforms to find and deliver rich, brand building content. This includes a thorough understanding of SEO best practices, content curation & management, conversion rate optimization, and an expert understanding of best copywriting principles, consumer psychology, storytelling, emotional value, and more to support and advance our editorial calendar and mission.

HOURS & LOCATION:

This is a full-time (40 hours/week) position that can be completed 100% remotely, but if you’re in the Los Angeles area, you’ll be expected to work out of our Marina Del Rey office twice per week. This is an independent contractor position to start, with a 3-month evaluation period prior to transitioning into a salaried position.

COMPENSATION: $45,000 - $65,000 annual salary, depending on experience.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

--Manage our team of writers who contribute to the blog, including communicating, answering questions, ensuring deadlines are met, providing article feedback, ensuring style guidelines are adhered to, and more
--Work alongside our Content Marketing Director and CMO to refine blog content strategy, optimize content curation/creation systems for greater output and efficiency, as well as optimize our blog as a channel for lead-generation and conversion from reader to customer
--Create our editorial calendar, and manage production & publishing of content to various platforms
---Conduct ongoing tests to pinpoint what storylines, tone, imagery, CTA’s etc. resonate best with our target audiences on various platforms where we publish content
--Collaborate with our designer(s) to craft compelling infographics, hero images, and more that’ll engage our readers

ESSENTIAL SKILLS

-- An arsenal of words and phrases written for successful blog posts, email campaigns, and social media posts, preferably for 3+ years in a professional setting.

items.title: Copywriter - eCommerce/Dropship
items.content:
SaleHoo is a New Zealand-based company creating online tools and training for people looking to start their own online businesses. We’re based in Christchurch, but the majority of our team work remotely from various places around the world.
We're looking for a talented individual to join us in writing content for our popular wholesale directory, SaleHoo.com
Our directory contains an educational section covering topics including eBay selling, Amazon selling, what products sell well online, how to market physical products online, importing and shipping and so on.
We're looking for someone with experience with these topics and industry to help us write lessons, scripts and blog posts (and whatever else turns up!).

  • You should be experienced in at least several aspects of this industry: For instance, online selling, wholesale sourcing, marketing physical products.
  • You must be able to break a task down and get right to the heart of it: No lessons full of fluff, no beating around the bush. Our users want clear-as-day, step-by-step, hype-free lessons.
  • You should be a clear thinker: Able to objectively analyse a piece and ask yourself whether it is truly succeeding in what it's trying to do, and not afraid to overhaul something that isn't working.
  • You must be good at paying attention to detail and checking facts (things change rapidly in this industry!)
  • And obviously, your technical grasp of English must be good and things you write must be readable and make sense. The "making sense" part is the most important. We can handle the odd erroneously-placed apostrophe, so long as the heart and structure of the writing is A-OK!
    This is a great opportunity to flex your writing muscles. While a lot of the content can be reasonably technical, the way we write the content has to be friendly, entertaining, personable and accessible to a wide audience.
    While qualifications or experience in writing or journalism would be valuable, we're more interested in industry knowledge and your ability to write with clarity. If you think you've got the spark we're after... then we want to hear from you.
    Please note: You must be able to provide at least 3-4 published pieces of industry-related content on authority sites that you have created, under your name.
    Neat things about working with us:
  • Flexible hours (we are happy to discuss full-time, part-time, contracting for the role).
  • Work from home (or from our Christchurch office)
  • Relaxed, ego-free, family-friendly work culture
    If you'd like to come work in our Christchurch office in Ferrymead, you also get:
  • Weekly Friday BBQ (or sushiBQ, or ThaiBQ)
  • Novelty coffee mugs
  • An extremely comfortable chair
  • Tap dancing seagulls
10d

items.title: Technical Writer at VividCortex (Chicago, IL) (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Senior
Industry: Databases, Information Services, Information Technology
Company size: 11-50 people
Company type: Private

Job description

About the role

The Technical Content Writer and Journalist develops the voice of VividCortex to create thought leadership content around business, strategy, technology, and future trends. You assist in the execution and distribution of content through various content vehicles, such as company blogs, whitepapers, ebooks, and product videos to help prospects fully understand the value of VividCortex in an engaging, brand-centric manner. You form strong partnerships with leaders inside and outside the organization, and help them turn their ideas into compelling content. You will report to the CMO and are a key member of our Marketing team.

Key Responsibilities:

    • Brainstorm, research, write, and distribute articles, blog posts, case studies, eBooks, whitepapers, and more, that are authoritative, clear, and informative and meets the needs of both key stakeholders and unique personas and user buyer journey stages.
    • Continually work with the extended marketing team to measure reader engagement, and iterate to improve content definition, distribution, and performance.
    • Engage with development team routinely to gain a full understanding of recent product releases and newest features to better understand ways to position VividCortex in the market.
    • Assist with the creation and development of print collateral such as brochures for tradeshows or events.
    • Work with customers for case studies/testimonials.
    • Balance content distribution efforts, producing a regular cadence of blog content, repositioning high-performing pieces, and managing the development long-tail content assets.

Requirements:

    • History of working with B2B organizations developing technology and business content in a regular cadence, or tech journalism experience.
    • Skilled and polished writer who can transform ideas and interviews into content quickly and efficiently.
    • Passion to combine strong writing skills with a love of technology.
    • Interested in the world of business and technology and love to read and write about it.
    • Ability to build a pipeline of successful content based on interviews with thought leaders.
    • Experience writing regular blog content that sparks a conversation.
    • Academic or professional experience in technical writing and or journalism.
    • Located in the Washington, DC or Chicago area, and available for occasional travel.

At VividCortex, we want to build a diverse team because it's the right thing to do, and because we believe diversity is strength. We encourage applicants from all walks of life and all backgrounds.

Note to Agencies and Recruiters: VividCortex has a strict company policy against engaging with unsolicited contact from agencies or recruiters.  Unsolicited resumes and leads are property of VividCortex and VividCortex explicitly denies that any information sent to VividCortex can be construed as consideration.

About VividCortex

VividCortex is a modern database monitoring platform that gives developers and DBAs deep visibility into the database. Our solution is delivered as software-as-a-service and helps our customers see and analyze the work their databases are doing in great detail. It addresses critical pain points in measuring and managing today's large, distributed, diverse storage tiers composed of multiple different clustered products, all working together.

Founded in 2012 by noted database experts, and backed by major venture capital and high-wealth individuals, VividCortex is headquartered in Charlottesville, Virginia with a remote team in Montevideo, Uruguay. With more than 750% year-over-year growth, VividCortex is a company on fire!

We have a fast-growing customer base of well-known companies, and a tremendous reputation in our market for delivering a high-quality, innovative solution for database performance problems that are common in tens of thousands of small and large organizations.

Benefits

Unlimited paid leave for any purpose (incl. maternity and paternity)
Excellent medical insurance and dental benefits
Equity
New MacBook or other Mac computer, as best suited to the position
Gym membership. We have quite a few CrossFitters at the office
A nerdy sense of humor, tax-free
Premium coffee, frequent team meals, snacks, and more

items.title: Brand and Communications Editor intern
items.content:
Are you obsessed with finding and sharing stories online? Do your friends look to you on Facebook and Twitter for the latest trends, ideas, and memes?

AuctionShelter is a London based tech start-up set on offering global buyers with a new way to bid on real estate deals. Backed by a successful Angel investor with a winning formula, we have been able to identify an area of the property market that has enormous potential.

AuctionShelter has a fast paced work environment and we seek talented people who crave learning new skills and aren't afraid to tackle big projects. As an intern you will get to work with a variety of our executive staff and will work on real projects that will help us grow.

Our ideal candidate is someone who walks into a room of people and can’t leave without making a few friends. Someone who is obsessed with branding, marketing, social media, blogging and is creative and thoughtful when interacting with online communities and building relationships.

What you’ll do:

For the duration of the internship, candidates will be assisting with ideation of creative assets, in support of client campaigns and internal marketing efforts. Interns will come away from the experience with first-hand knowledge of agency best practices.
Candidates will be working closely with the creative content team on real world client deliverables by:

• Define our editorial agenda on all content that goes out to clients across blogs, emails, podcasts, video, social, our website and one off campaigns.
• Blog content for AuctionShelter’s news blog and social media
• Helping to develop content templates for the AuctionShelter team
• Helping to write content for client presentation decks for the creative team (intro pages, next step pages, project descriptions, etc)
• Researching on topics and data for senior writers to create content for clients
• Lead generation through online research
• Promotion and outreach
• Streamlining the process of finding, communicating with, processing, and evaluating potential clients

Who we are looking for:

• Junior, Senior, or recent graduate pursuing a B.A. in Advertising, Creative Writing, English, Journalism, or Communications or equivalent course in your country, business, marketing, computer science and technical roles.
• A love of brands creative content and copy.
• Buckets of ambition, a passion for your craft and plenty of hustle.
• Research on market, able to understand the trends
• Proactive and able to take ownership of the assigned tasks
• A passion for Audio Editing, Audio clean up, editing Podcasts, Podcast set up, video editing and blogging

Benefits & Perks:

AuctionShelter is a young and international team, where you will have the opportunity to develop in a dynamic environment. Our colleagues are highly motivated, open-minded people, self-driven and with a great team spirit. You get access to the newest and most innovative technologies.

• Fun, fast-paced, team oriented environment
• Remote and flexible working
